body:
This question was already discussed [here](https://github.com/ladybug-tools/honeybee/issues/175#issuecomment-329817088), with a temporary solution by Mostapha. 



So I´m just sharing my inputs on it.



For the new HB+ it´s possible to just write the files and then run them on different OS where you can benefit from more cores-so the simulation time will be much less. 

But when you change OS, you run into some problems as backward and forward slashes in the path names etc. - therefore the attached script is useful.



In the future a more sophisticated way would be appreciated e.g. while writing the file, having a possibility to choose what is the platform on which it will be run + number of cores in case of Linux based OS.



Best

Peter Z
topic: Running/Writing files from HB[+] for other OS - e.g. Linux for multicore-processing
